text: When a bomb is smashed, a dark smoke curls out, concealing those who wish to hide and choking everyone else.
Now you see him, now you don’t… and now you’re seeing double.
Djinn come in many forms, but none is more feared and revered throughout Araby than the Serpent.
This Djinn has given in to the burning power of Aqshy, though those that burn so bright do not burn long.

Inside this ornate staff decorated with snake motifs is bound a malignant and ancient Serpent Djinn, imprisoned by powerful enchantments woven by Jaffar. Only Jaffar's will is strong enough to temporarily unleash it upon his enemies on the battlefield.
Jaffar's natural gravitas coupled with his sorcerous might produce an oppressive aura of dread and authority around him that none under his command can resist.
The caster calls on the elements of the desert and draws upon the fortune they can bestow.
By invoking the Element of Fire, one of the caster's hands becomes burning hot, which he can use to smite enemies.
By invoking the Element of Fire, one of the caster's hands becomes burning hot, which he can use to smite enemies.
The sorcerer channels the immense power of the Djinn through his own body and lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
The sorcerer channels the immense power of the Djinn through his own body and lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
The sorcerer creates the illusion of a huge host of fearsome warriors, bearing down inexorably upon his startled foes.
The sorcerer creates the illusion of a huge host of fearsome warriors, bearing down inexorably upon his startled foes.
By invoking the Element of Water, moisture rises up from the very rocks and sand, turning the ground into deadly quicksand.
By invoking the Element of Water, moisture rises up from the very rocks and sand, turning the ground into deadly quicksand.
Commanding the Desert Spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
Commanding the Desert Spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the sorcerer's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the sorcerer's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Give a Djinn too much freedom and they will start thinking dangerous thoughts.
Heat of the desert, the sand is on my face, without accomplice the soldier knows no disgrace...
Breathe in, release, breathe out, repeat.
Magical Support: Piercing Bolts of Ruin

One of the Golden Magus' most infamous creations, this fiery curved sword is kept most of the time inside a jar filled with a slimy orange solution. When drawn out of it, the sword catches a mystical fire that the Magus uses for battle, theatrics and summoning Djinn spirits. Contrary to popular belief, the ship is named after the sword.
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Fire Efreets to unleash a barrage of burning bolts upon your enemies.
Orders the Flaming Scimitar's Tempest Djinns to conjure a potent torrent of curved windswords upon the battlefield.
The Golden Magus has an extensive library of magic books. He devours their knowledge and they devour his enemies. What a wonderful agreement.
The cool and protective wind of the north, it blows away the evil and wrongness in the skies and shields all from harm.
The dusty and unforgivable wind of the south, it brings with it the fury and the sweltering heat of the desert.
The power the Golden Magus wields comes at a price. If his concentration wanes during battle, the Djinn under his control will sense his weakness and attempt to turn the Magus' power against himself.
The desert nomads are fierce fighters and their howling battle cries chill one to the marrow.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, eventually disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.
Slay, slay and slay some more so I might feed on their souls, I demand it!
Your soul is mine, your very life is mine to devour! Hurry now, so you are merely the entree to my feast!
Death is not the end, give yourself to death, give yourself to martyrdom and your name will echo through the ages.
The deserts of Araby are a harsh mistress but not always...
It's as if they have melted away into the Arabyan dunes, nowhere to be seen.
The shard tears open a fragile portal to the realm of Chaos just long enough for vile Chaos Spawn to spill forth.
Trust absolutely in the gods, never let your faith waver and you may yet live.
Filled with dread, their bodies freeze for none can withstand the Gorgon's glare.
The tactical burning of special tobacco obscures the unit and its allies, making them harder to hit with missiles. It also temporarily numbs the pain of warriors in range.
Taken by Fatandira from the tomb of the Liche Lord Karitamen in the Borderlands, this pair of Nehekharan Khopeshes magically enhance their owner's combat skills, and weaken anyone struck by them.
The Winds of Magic ebb and flow with the tide of battle. The more heavily-beset a Djinn is, the more likely the sorcery that binds them will fade away.
Once the Djinn's manifested form has been severely damaged, their binding dissolves and they dissipate back into the ether.
Whilst it remains bound to its magical jar, the Djinn will fight with every ounce of its strength against its master's enemies.
Djinn||This unit is a Djinn, an elemental spirit (has physical resistance, does not rout, is immune to terror, takes damage when [[img:icon_morale]][[/img]]{{tr:morale}} is low)
The power and number of Djinn trapped in the vessels in the Carriage makes it a powerful nexus for aethyrical forces.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Crack open the djinn vessel, release the Djinn held within.
Fueled by a fanatic devotion to the Djinn, the Dervishers spin wildly during their charge.
As combat rages on, the Dervishers' zealotry drives them further into their trance, spinning recklessly, madly attacking the enemy even as they are being attacked themselves.

The nomad tribes of Araby have inhabited it for generations, well before the first cities were founded on the coasts. Their preferred fighting style consists on keeping their distance from their foes using their mounts or knowledge of the terrain, while peppering them with projectiles, or if necessary, unleashing a furious charge on them.
The Black Scimitar Guards are one of the most elite units in the armies of Araby, as long as the fight goes in their favour, their pride will swell and embolden them to fight more effectively.
The Wizard ensorcels allied weapons, making them burn with a savage fire. The targets of the spell are augmented with superior flaming blades.
The Djinn conjures a boiling ball of magical flame and hurls it at a nearby foe.
Commanding the Desert Spirit of Da'ru'de, the sorcerer engulfs his foes in a swirling cloud of choking sand and dust.
The projectile is filled with the wrath of the captured Fire Efreet and creates a firestorm at the point of impact.
Jaffar has achieved the power to transmogrify from human form to Djinn and back again at will, and often at the most opportune moments.
Jaffar has achieved the power to transmogrify from human form to Djinn and back again at will, and often at the most opportune moments.
They are closely tied to their master, who amply rewards them for their loyalty with riches, luxuries and prestige.
They can take a lot of pain, but that only makes them angry.
The chilling battle-cry of “Al Muktar" is both famous and feared throughout the world.
The haughty riders charge at the enemy as if they were invulnerable.
The ropes wrap around their enemies and hinder their movements.
The Giant Vulture feeds on its unlucky victims – regaining strength in the process.
When the vultures circle overhead, death is not far away.
The most terrible incantations, invoking fire and destruction, cause the ground to crack and extrude boiling magma. Things are about to get a little toasty!
Snow and ice rise from the land, freezing and blinding any and all in their path with an unnatural cold.
Bright beams of burning energy leap from the sorcerer's eyes and scythe through all before him.
Camels are intractable mounts, but they hardly tire and can go for long periods without water.
The Djinn channels his immense powers to lay a terrible curse upon his foes.
Through her innate magic, the Sea Nymph is able to heal the injuries of her allies much faster than by natural means.
Incarnate Curse of the Midnight Wind
The Tempest Djinn invokes a curse, hexing the surrounding enemies and blighting their ability to attack and defend.
Around the Desert Spirit, the ground turns into bottomless quicksand, dragging any unfortunates down into the abyss.
A blazing aura surrounds the Fire Efreet's allies, shielding them with protective flame and augmenting their abilities.
The anger of the Sultan of Flames is absolute, his unstoppable fire scorching any opponent who dares to come too close.
Warriors shiver and shake in a wintry grasp until the piercing cold reaches their hearts and, finally, they move no more.
The Raging Tempest's allies become a blur of cyan energy which darts through the air at incredible speed before coalescing back into their natural form.
Khar-mel has the power to bless those around her, with the power that characterizes the Djinn, channeling all the power of nature.
Radiant Pegasi are a living siphon of light and magic. When threatened, they can discharge those shimmering forces against aggressors.
Summoned creatures exist in this world on borrowed time, disappearing back to the Winds from whence they came.
By invoking the Element of Water, moisture rises up from the very rocks and sand, turning the ground into deadly quicksand.
The sorcerer channels the immense power of the Djinn through his own body and lays a terrible curse upon his foes.
Leave none alive! They will never raise their weapons against the Sultan again!
The Djinn fill their faithful with unwavering will and imbue their weapons with their elemental magic.
Jaffar has to use all his magical powers to maintain his Djinn form. Casting spells weakens his hold on the Winds of Magic.
Wealth cannot buy you victory, but it can buy you a damn good enchanted blade.
The blade has been modified with a spell that coats it in vile poison at a moment’s notice.
The sea is summoned, and a great tide coalesces upon the battlefield to drench all those that oppose the Djinn.
The Djinn seizes the Winds on the battlefield, directing them against the foe to batter targets with unhallowed gales.
Spell number of uses: %+n for "Mirage" and "Mirage Upgraded"
